instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 - cannot see the battery - liquid damaged. - Board-A
threads.message:
when I got it, i had to replace u7000, Q7030 and Q7035 because it didn't get a green light and PPBUS was 0v

now I get a green light, and posts but the battery is not detected.
can run on battery once charger applied then remove the charger.

I also have replaced Q7080, Q7055, Q7085 and D7005 just in case.

diode mode on:
SCL = 0.500
SDA = 0.498


resistance between pin 17/18 and 27/28 from U7000
17/18 = 3.1 ohm
27/28 = 21 ohm



PPBUS_G3H = 12.21v on charger
PPBUS_G3H = 11.39v on batt

real charger.
tested with two known working batteries.



[B]DEAD SMC?[/B]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 - cannot see the battery - liquid damaged. - Board-A
[SOLVED]820-3115 - cannot see the battery - liquid damaged. - Board-A
threads.message:
diode mode on:
SCL = 0.500
SDA = 0.498

are near same on known working board

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 - cannot see the battery - liquid damaged. - Board-A
threads.message: Yes, but there is activity on those lines???? Check with oscilloscope....

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 - cannot see the battery - liquid damaged. - Board-A
threads.message: :( i dont have one.  these cheap USB to PC oscilloscope are they any good?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 - cannot see the battery - liquid damaged. - Board-A
threads.message: Also you have 12.21V on PPBUS_G3H, this means SMC is not working...

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3115 - cannot see the battery - liquid damaged. - Board-A
[SOLVED]820-3115 - cannot see the battery - liquid damaged. - Board-A
threads.message:
I've replaced the SMC. it can see the battery now.

PPBUS_G3H is now at 12.58v

solved.
